website_summaries.verdict: New photographers looking for the 35mm film experience without the upfront expense will enjoy this classic-styled SLR.
pros: A true single-lens reflex targeted at casual photographers
Takes fun images with a retro feel thanks to its durable glass lens and solid SLR action
Competes well against Loma and Holga retro cameras
cons: Missing the features of high-end cameras, and lens is fixed and not interchangeable

customer_reviews.title: TWO defective cameras
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed :( The camera is very light weight, compact, and cute - I was so excited. Unfortunately, the first camera I ordered was totally jammed and defective... but since I liked the camera anyway I ordered an exchange. Much to my dismay, the replacement was defective as well! I am going to try and return it now. Honestly wanted to be satisfied and keep the camera, sad my products didn't work. Customer service was great though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great look, doesn't work. Trying my hardest to fix.
customer_reviews.text: Love the look, but it came fully wound so I can't take photos ... no idea what to do which is odd because I collect cameras that use film.
customer_reviews.author: BJK stylist

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Nice simple slr. Takes good photos. Adjustable shutter speeds would really make it great. It is a good value for the money
customer_reviews.author: Leroy Meyers

customer_reviews.title: Really awesome little thing
customer_reviews.text: Really awesome little thing, great natural vignette in certain instances. Highly recommended for those into lomography. Certainly not a toy camera, has been quite durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Surprisingly sturdy. Feels great to hold and carry. Takes good quality photos, too
customer_reviews.author: zachary gorelik

customer_reviews.title: Get This Before It Gone
customer_reviews.text: I am loving this camera! I'm not quite understanding why some of the reviews say that this is not a good camera, but their wrong. It doesn't feel like a toy camera, it doesn't have a weird texture feel to the camera surface or strong smell. It's perfect. It as exactly as seller described it and it comes with English instruction. I don't mind that it has Chinese writing on camera surface. The only complaint I have is the camera strap is a little flimsy so I would replace it as soon as possible. The camera works very well and it was a excellent condition when I took it out the box. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: T. M. White

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: it was damaged, doesnt work and the lense has a blurr in it,,,, also its all written in chinese
customer_reviews.author: Fabbie Stauffer

customer_reviews.title: Appraisal
customer_reviews.text: To start with, i love the camera. It's the first Chinese SLR in my collection. I haven't had the chance to use it yet but upon checking its functions it appears to be ok. I 've been searching for this model for years now. Second, i greatly appreciate Amazon's fantastic service and prompt dispatch of my merchandise. Not every retailer of photographic goods in the Western world ship to or do business with the Near East. Amazon is a blessing.
customer_reviews.author: Dikran Yacoubian

customer_reviews.title: Ehh...
customer_reviews.text: I knew this was Chinese, but I didn't know that they were so poorly made. The thing was covered in dried adhesive, there were gaps between the parts, and it felt like the the thing was about to walk apart. Not to mention that it rips the film sprockets and gets stuck mid-roll. You're better off with a holga. Not worth $50.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It might work?
customer_reviews.text: The camera did not come with instructions in any language. I don’t even know how to load the film because I can’t get the back open. I don’t know if it’s any good or not because I can’t use it.
customer_reviews.author: winsumbuc

customer_reviews.title: Your better off getting a used Canon Rebel G
customer_reviews.text: Your better off getting a used Canon Rebel G. I bought a used Rebel G off Amazon. It can handle all of my Canon EOS Lensrs. Plus They make a Holgate lens for SLRS B&H has it for 45.00. Plus you can do alot more with a Rebel G. Don't waste your time with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Great Wall 35mm PF-1 Hipstermatic SLR Camera
product_meta.description: The Ultimate Toy 35mm SLR Camera is back, in a limited edition, under the Great Wall name. A true 35mm SLR with built in Flash, in a RETRO STYLE that takes the most amazing Lomo like and Holga type photos. Through the Lens viewfinder (SLR) Single Lens Reflex Split Focusing Screen Built in LED Exposure Meter Built in Flash Brand New 35mm SLR Camera from the same factory that made these for Fuji and Haminex. We allocated this new "Old Stock" straight from the factory. We have a limited supply of these brand new 35mm SLR Cameras Great Wall PF-1 and, it has a fixed shutter speed, in an ultra sturdy plastic SLR camera, you can adjust the exposure with your aperture. Moreover, it has a light meter inside that tells you if you’re using the right aperture, the batteries for this camera are simple AA batteries! The batteries run the flash and the light meter. Comes with leatherette case, strap and Lens Cap and a Camera Instruction Booklet in English. This rare find can be yours. This camera was marketed in the 80's through the 90's as the Fujica ST-F, The Haminex 35 Reflex Flash, Nagai SRF and the Yumica RFX-1. Get yours while supplies last. Think of it as a Holga Classic, with a SLR view-finder and a glass lens. The shutter, makes a mighty Thunka -klunk and you have to be proficient in film loading, to get the film take-up going sometimes, but these loveable clunkers reward you with the most amazing shots this side of the Lomo Longitude and Holga Latitude Lines! Beautiful vignetted, Lo-Fi images captured with this baby, will thrill and delight you and yours. We dubbed these the Hipstermatic because of the true warm vintage feel, these little plastic SLR's give to your unique art and vision. These are not for the weak of heart, and do not expect a fit and trim Canon or Nikon clone, these are true Holga-Style Toy Cameras that "out-holga", and "out-lomo" anything these fine Toy Camera manufactures ever produced.
feature_bullets: True 35mm SLR Camera with Light Meter and Flash and F-40mm Glass Lens 1:2.8
Imagine a Holga 35mm Classic with an SLR through the Lens capture
Built in Flash and Light Meter run on Two AA Batteries
Uses standard easy to find 35mm film producing Lomo Like vignetted images
Comes with Leatherette case, strap, and Lens Cap and an English Instruction Sheet
